headline: Ask HN: Why Isn't Starlink Built on Solar Powered Drones?
description:
I just stumbled on this video from ETH Zurich [1]. They are demonstrating an solar powered drone with unlimited range, as it can recharge during the day and flight battery-powered during the night. BEA Systems has a military prototype that can flight for up to one year [2].

I am wondering if such as plane could be used as a 4G/5G relay that could stay indefinitively over the clouds, providing Internet access to rural areas. That would have huge advantages compared to SpaceX's Starlink:

* The cost of such drones would be orders of magnitude cheaper than a Starlink satellite. These drones would also be easily serviceable and upgradable.

* No need for a new communication protocol and hardware, just use 4G or 5G.

* Round-trip-time and connection quality would be significantly better.

* Only specific areas could be targeted by these drones. Meanwhile, Starlink satellites are constantly moving on their orbits and have to cover the whole globe to be any kind of useful.

* No space debrit.

--

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8m4_NpTQn0E

[2] https://www.baesystems.com/en/product/phasa-35
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: 为什么 "星链 "没有建立在太阳能无人机上？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: 為什麼 "星鏈 "沒有建立在太陽能無人機上？
description_zh-Hans:
我刚刚偶然发现了苏黎世联邦理工学院的这段视频[1]。他们正在展示一种太阳能无人机，其航程不受限制，因为它可以在白天充电，在夜间以电池为动力飞行。BEA系统公司有一个军用原型机，可以飞行一年[2]。

我在想，这样的飞机是否可以用作4G/5G中继器，可以无限期地停留在云层上，向农村地区提供互联网接入。与SpaceX的Starlink相比，这将有巨大的优势：

* 这种无人机的成本将比Starlink卫星便宜好几个数量级。这些无人机也很容易维修和升级。

* 不需要新的通信协议和硬件，只需使用4G或5G。

* 往返时间和连接质量将大大改善。

* 这些无人机只能针对特定地区。同时，Starlink卫星在其轨道上不断移动，必须覆盖整个地球才能发挥任何作用。

*没有空间碎片。

--

[1] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8m4_NpTQn0E

[2] https://www.baesystems.com/en/product/phasa-35
